content.title: Blood Vessels: Fundamental Anatomy
content.summary: Blood vessels are tubular structures forming the circulatory system, transporting blood throughout the body. The three main types—arteries, veins, and capillaries—differ in structure and function.

types.name: Arteries
types.function: Carry oxygenated blood away from the heart to tissues

types.name: Veins
types.function: Return deoxygenated blood from tissues to the heart
types.characteristics: Thinner walls, contain valves, low pressure

types.name: Capillaries
types.function: Enable gas and nutrient exchange between blood and tissues
types.characteristics: Single endothelial cell layer, microscopic diameter

basic_physiology.circulation_path: Heart → Arteries → Arterioles → Capillaries → Venules → Veins → Heart

content.statement: Blood Vessels: Fundamental Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Foundations that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Blood Vessels: Fundamental Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Blood Vessels: Fundamental Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Blood Vessels: Fundamental Anatomy.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

definition.@value: Tubular structures that form the circulatory system, including arteries, veins, and capillaries

learning_objectives: Name the three main types of blood vessels
Describe the primary function of each vessel type
Explain how vessel structure relates to function
Understand blood volume distribution in the vascular system
clinical_pearls: Veins serve as the body's main blood reservoir (60-70% of blood volume)
Capillary exchange is the purpose of the entire circulatory system
Understanding normal anatomy is essential for recognizing pathology
Vascular surgery focuses primarily on arteries and veins, not capillaries

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Blood Vessels: Fundamental Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
